Name: Scarab of Men-kheper-ra
Description: Steatite scarab with stylised back, inscribed on the underside with two facing personifications of the Nile flood (Hapy), either side of a cartouche containing the throne-name of king Tuthmosis III (Menkheperra). Menkheperra scarabs were popular from the time of that king's reign in the late 15th century BC down to the Late Period, eight centuries later.
